Detailed Description

Basic Storage Kit exception class.

Implements the basic functionality of the exception class used internally by the Storage Kit.

Definition at line 19 of file Error.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

StorageKit::Error::Error ( const int errorCode,
const char * errorMessage = NULL )
 

Creates an Error object with the given error code and message. This general constructor is provided to handle cases where unexpected error codes are encountered. For expected errors, creating a corresponding subclass of Error (i.e. EInsufficientMemory) is recommended.

Definition at line 13 of file Error.cpp.

StorageKit::Error::~Error ( ) [virtual]
 

Frees the object's error message string, and then destroys the object.

Definition at line 39 of file Error.cpp.

StorageKit::Error::Error ( const Error & ref ) [private]
 

Copy constructor. For the sake of efficiency, this constructor is private to prevent the use of pass by value and pass by reference exceptions.

StorageKit::Error::Error ( ) [private]
 

Default constructor. This constructor is private to prevent creation without the inclusion of an error code and message.

Member Function Documentation

const int StorageKit::Error::ErrorCode ( ) const
 

Returns the object's error code.

Definition at line 43 of file Error.cpp.

const char * StorageKit::Error::ErrorMessage ( ) const
 

Returns the object's error message.

Definition at line 47 of file Error.cpp.

void StorageKit::Error::PrintDebugInfo ( ) const [protected, virtual]
 

Prints one or more lines of debugging information to standard output. The default implementation prints the object's base class name and the object's error message. Automatically called in the object's constructor if kDebug is true.

Definition at line 52 of file Error.cpp.

void StorageKit::Error::SetErrorMessage ( const char * errorMessage ) [private]
 

Sets the error message for this Error object. Allocates the necessary resources for the given the string (freeing any previous resources, if they exist), and then makes a copy of it. If errorMessage is NULL, then kDefaultErrorMessage is used.

Definition at line 20 of file Error.cpp.

The error code for this object.

Definition at line 78 of file Error.h.

char * StorageKit::Error::fErrorMessage [private]
 

Pointer to the error message for this object.

Definition at line 82 of file Error.h.

const bool StorageKit::Error::kDebug = true [static, protected]
 

Class-wide flag to enable or disable debugging messages to standard output. If true, a message is printed each time an Error object is constructed specifying the object's type and its associated error message.

Definition at line 51 of file Error.h.

const char StorageKit::Error::kDefaultErrorMessage[] = "Undefined Storage Kit Error" [static, protected]
 

Default error message. Returned by ErrorMessage() if the error message specified to the object's constructor is NULL.
